snippet: There are reasons to believe that college has become easier over the last few decades. And yet in that time, the market value of a college degree has been rising. How can this disconnect be explained?
abstract: There are reasons to believe that college has become easier over the last few decades. And yet in that time, the market value of a college degree has been rising. How can this disconnect be explained?

headline.main: Getting a Degree: Less Rigor, More Value
